description: Provides details about how an DataSync transfer location for an Amazon FSx for OpenZFS file system is configured.

parameters.name: LocationArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the FSx for OpenZFS location to describe.

nested_items.name: LocationArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the FSx for OpenZFS location that was described.

nested_items.name: LocationUri
nested_items.description: The uniform resource identifier (URI) of the FSx for OpenZFS location that was described.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupArns
nested_items.description: The ARNs of the security groups that are configured for the FSx for OpenZFS file system.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MountOptions
nested_items.description: Specifies how DataSync can access a location using the NFS protocol.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: Specifies the NFS version that you want DataSync to use when mounting your NFS share. If the server refuses to use the version specified, the task fails.
: DataSync chooses NFS version 4.1.
NFS3: Stateless protocol version that allows for asynchronous writes on the server.
NFSv4_0: Stateful, firewall-friendly protocol version that supports delegations and pseudo file systems.
NFSv4_1: Stateful protocol version that supports sessions, directory delegations, and parallel data processing. NFS version 4.1 also includes all features available in version 4.0.

nested_items.name: Domain
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the Windows domain that your storage virtual machine (SVM) belongs to.

nested_items.name: MountOptions
nested_items.description: Specifies the version of the Server Message Block (SMB) protocol that DataSync uses to access an SMB file server.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: By default, DataSync automatically chooses an SMB protocol version based on negotiation with your SMB file server. You also can configure DataSync to use a specific SMB version, but we recommend doing this only if DataSync has trouble negotiating with the SMB file server automatically.

: DataSync and the SMB file server negotiate the highest version of SMB that they mutually support between 2.1 and 3.1.1. This is the recommended option. If you instead choose a specific version that your file server doesn't support, you may get an Operation Not Supported error.
SMB3: Restricts the protocol negotiation to only SMB version 3.0.2.
SMB2: Restricts the protocol negotiation to only SMB version 2.1.
SMB2_0: Restricts the protocol negotiation to only SMB version 2.0.
SMB1: Restricts the protocol negotiation to only SMB version 1.0.

nested_items.name: Password
nested_items.description: Specifies the password of a user who has permission to access your SVM.

nested_items.name: User
nested_items.description: Specifies a user that can mount and access the files, folders, and metadata in your SVM.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The time that the FSx for OpenZFS location was created.
